page.title: 12FARMING IN SYDMONTON
page.content: THE MAIN CROPS ARE WHEAT & BARLEY. THE HEDGES HAVE BEEN TAKEN OUT IN THE LOWER FIELDS TO MAKE IT EASIER WORK FOR THE LARGE COMBINES USED THESE DAYS. ABOUT A THIRD OF THE AREA IS USED FOR GRAZING CATTLE AND SHEEP. SHEEP ARE NOW COMING BACK IN QUANTITY. THIS WAS AN IMPORTANT AREA IN THE GREAT DAYS OF THE WOOLEN TRADE - 15th CENTURY- WITH MANY LARGE FLOCKS ON THE DOWNS. CATTLE ARE NOT GENERALLY KEPT, ALTHOUGH SOME MAY BE GRAZED FOR A SHORT PERIOD. THE WOODS AT FOSSICKS ARE USED FOR TIMBER AND NEW PLANTINGS HAVE BEEN MADE.ALSO BELOW NUTHANGER THERE IS A NEW SPINNEY OF MIXED TREES. THERE IS A SMALL HOLDING CALLED BISHOPS HILL OF 16 ACRES USED FOR PIGS & CATTLE. HALF THE LAND IS OWNED BY PRUDENTIAL ASSURANCE AND MANAGED BY TWO FARMERS. ONLY ONE FARMER IN THE AREA OWNS HIS OWN LAND.
